title: Milton Glaser's Bob Dylan poster
content:
Hey, Does anyone know the typeface on Milton Glaser’s Bob Dylan poster?  
thanks,  
ariella

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080607042149im_/http:/typophile.com/files/dylan_4648.jpg)

 [‹ TERA NOVA font ID](http://web.archive.org/web/20080607042149/http:/typophile.com/node/46099 "Go to previous forum topic") [Cannot figure this one out... ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080607042149/http:/typophile.com/node/46109 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ariellasm

comments.content:
wow it’s great to see that again. thanks for posting it.

it’s an early memory for me - one of my first moments of (some sort of) recognition of “graphic design”.

i was just a kid and it was my older brother’s album. i was way more into the poster than the music.

Has been discussed before.  
See [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080607042149/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41379).  
Has been digitized as [Bebit](http://web.archive.org/web/20080607042149/http:/www.paratype.com/pstore/fonts/Bebit.htm).
It really is brilliant. The poster I mean.
I remember being in design classes and pulling that out of an album I had just walked home with. It really had a big effect on the way I thought about color.
